monsters.name: Purple Worm
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 9

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The worm makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 22 (3d8 + 9) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 19 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.
If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tail Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 19 (3d6 + 9) piercing damage, and the target must make a 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Quadrone
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.desc: The quadrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.desc: If the quadrone dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quadrone makes two fist attacks or four shortbow attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Quaggoth
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Wounded Fury
traits.desc: While it has 10 hit points or fewer, the quaggoth has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quaggoth makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Quaggoth Spore Servant
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 8

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spore servant makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Quaggoth Thonot
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Wounded Fury
traits.desc: While it has 10 hit points or fewer, the quaggoth has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quaggoth makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

spells: The quaggoth's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 11). The quaggoth can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spells.At will: feather fall, mage hand (the hand is invisible)

spells.1/day each: cure wounds, enlarge/reduce, heat metal, mirror image

monsters.name: Quasit
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The quasit can use its action to polymorph into a beast form that resembles a bat (speed 10 feet fly 40 ft.), a centipede (40 ft., climb 40 ft.), or a toad (40 ft., swim 40 ft.), or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The quasit has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Claw (Bite in Beast Form)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Scare (1/Day)
actions.desc: One creature of the quasit's choice within 20 feet of it must succeed on a 10 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the quasit is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.desc: The quasit magically turns invisible until it attacks or uses Scare, or until its {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the quasit wears or carries is invisible with it.

monsters.name: Quipper
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The quipper has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.desc: The quipper can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

monsters.name: Rakshasa
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Eberron: Rising from the Last War
monsters.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Limited Magic Immunity
traits.desc: The rakshasa can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The rakshasa makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage, and the target is cursed if it is a creature. The magical curse takes effect whenever the target takes a short or long rest, filling the target's thoughts with horrible images and dreams. The cursed target gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a remove curse spell or similar magic.

spells: The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect thoughts, disguise self, mage hand, minor illusion

spells.3/day each: charm person, detect magic, invisibility, major image, suggestion

spells.1/day each: dominate person, fly, plane shift, true seeing

monsters.name: Rat
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The rat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

monsters.name: Raven
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.desc: The raven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful 10 Wisdom (Insight) check.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage.

monsters.name: Red Dragon Wyrmling
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 14

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Red Slaad
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The slaad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The slaad makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or be infected with a disease—a minuscule slaad egg.
A humanoid host can carry only one slaad egg to term at a time. Over three months, the egg moves to the chest cavity, gestates, and forms a slaad tadpole. In the 24-hour period before giving birth, the host starts to feel unwell, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. At birth, the tadpole chews its way through vital organs and out of the host's chest in 1 round, killing the host in the process.
If the disease is cured before the tadpole's emergence, the unborn slaad is disintegrated.

monsters.name: Reef Shark
source: Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.desc: The shark has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the shark's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.desc: The shark can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Remorhaz
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 10

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.desc: A creature that touches the remorhaz or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 40 (6d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the remorhaz can't bite another target.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc:
The remorhaz makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the remorhaz, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the remorhaz's turns.
If the remorhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the remorhaz must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the remorhaz. If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monsters.name: Revenant
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Eberron: Rising from the Last War
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, psychic
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The revenant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the revenant takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the revenant's next turn. The revenant's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: When the revenant's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

traits.name: Turn Immunity
traits.desc: The revenant is immune to effects that turn undead.

traits.name: Vengeful Tracker
traits.desc: The revenant knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and the revenant are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by the revenant dies, the revenant knows.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The revenant makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature against which the revenant has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the revenant can grapple the target (escape 14) provided the target is Large or smaller.

actions.name: Vengeful Glare
actions.desc: The revenant targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is paralyzed until the revenant deals damage to it, or until the end of the revenant's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is frightened of the revenant for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the revenant, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Rhinoceros
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the rhinoceros moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Riding Horse
source: Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Roc
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Keen Sight
traits.desc: The roc has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 27 (4d8 + 9) piercing damage.

actions.name: Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 23 (4d6 + 9) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the roc can't use its talons on another target.

monsters.name: Roper
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

traits.name: Grasping Tendrils
traits.desc: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a 15 Strength check against it.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The roper makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tendril
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. The target is grappled (escape 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the roper can't use the same tendril on another target.

actions.name: Reel
actions.desc: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

monsters.name: Rug of Smothering
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.desc: The rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the rug must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: Damage Transfer
traits.desc: While it is grappling a creature, the rug takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the rug remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal rug.

actions.name: Smother
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. The creature is grappled (escape 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, blinded, and at risk of suffocating, and the rug can't smother another target. In addition, at the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Rust Monster
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Iron Scent
traits.desc: The rust monster can pinpoint, by scent, the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of it.

traits.name: Rust Metal
traits.desc: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Non magical ammunition made of metal that hits the rust monster is destroyed after dealing damage.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Antennae
actions.desc:
The rust monster corrodes a nonmagical ferrous metal object it can see within 5 feet of it. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a 11 Dexterity saving throw to avoid the rust monster's touch.
If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, it takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

monsters.name: Saber-Toothed Tiger
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The tiger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or spear.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monsters.name: Sahuagin Baron
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sahuagin makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws or trident.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Trident
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monsters.name: Sahuagin Priestess

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.desc: The sahuagin has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

traits.name: Shark Telepathy
traits.desc: The sahuagin can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sahuagin makes two melee attacks: one with her bite and one with her claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

spells: The sahuagin is a 6th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): guidance, thaumaturgy

spells.1st level (4 slots): bless, detect magic, guiding bolt

monsters.name: Salamander
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.desc: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Heated Weapons
traits.desc: Any metal melee weapon the salamander wields deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The salamander makes two attacks: one with its spear and one with its tail.

actions.name: Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can't make tail attacks against other targets.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Ram
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Scarecrow
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, unconscious
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the scarecrow remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary, inanimate scarecrow.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The scarecrow makes two claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (2d4 + 1) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of the scarecrow's next turn.

actions.name: Terrifying Glare
actions.desc: The scarecrow targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the scarecrow, the target must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw or be magically frightened until the end of the scarecrow's next turn. The frightened target is paralyzed.

monsters.name: Scorpion
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

actions.name: Sting
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a 9 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monsters.name: Scout
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

traits.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
traits.desc: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The scout makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Sea Hag
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Horrific Appearance
traits.desc:
Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag and can see the hag's true form must make a 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the hag is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the hag's Horrific Appearance for the next 24 hours.
Unless the target is {@status surprised} or the revelation of the hag's true form is sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the initial saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Death Glare
actions.desc: The hag targets one frightened creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the hag, it must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or drop to 0 hit points.

actions.name: Illusory Appearance
actions.desc:
The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like an ugly creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The effect ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.
The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have no claws, but someone touching her hand might feel the claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a 16 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.desc: The sea horse can breathe only underwater.

monsters.name: Shadow
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +6.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

actions.name: Strength Drain
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.
If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

monsters.name: Shadow Demon
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, necrotic, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The demon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in bright light, the demon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

traits.name: Shadow Stealth
traits.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the demon can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 10 (2d6 + 3) psychic damage or, if the demon had advantage on the attack roll, 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage.

monsters.name: Shambling Mound
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 10

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The shambling mound makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled (escape 14), and the shambling mound uses its Engulf on it.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.desc: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. The engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the mound's turns or take 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

monsters.name: Shield Guardian
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10
monsters.languages: understands commands given in any language but can't speak

traits.name: Bound
traits.desc: The shield guardian is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the guardian to travel to it, and the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is transferred to the guardian.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The shield guardian regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

traits.name: Spell Storing
traits.desc: A spellcaster who wears the shield guardian's amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the guardian casts the stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The guardian makes two fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Shield
reactions.desc: When a creature makes an attack against the wearer of the guardian's amulet, the guardian grants a +2 bonus to the wearer's AC if the guardian is within 5 feet of the wearer.

monsters.name: Shrieker
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: While the shrieker remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

reactions.name: Shriek
reactions.desc: When bright light or a creature is within 30 feet of the shrieker, it emits a shriek audible within 300 feet of it. The shrieker continues to shriek until the disturbance moves out of range and for 1d4 of the shrieker's turns afterward.

monsters.name: Silver Dragon Wyrmling
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 14

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

actions.name: Cold Breath
actions.desc: The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Paralyzing Breath
actions.desc: The dragon exhales paralyzing gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Skeleton
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
The Lost Dungeon of Rickedness: Big Rick Energy
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
monsters.languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Slaad Tadpole
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The slaad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Smoke Mephit
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.desc: When the mephit dies, it leaves behind a cloud of smoke that fills a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on its space. The sphere is heavily obscured. Wind disperses the cloud, which otherwise lasts for 1 minute.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

actions.name: Cinder Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of smoldering ash. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the mephit's next turn.

spells: The mephit can innately cast dancing lights, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

monsters.name: Solar
source: Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
monsters.damage_resistances: radiant, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.desc: The solar's weapon attacks are magical. When the solar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 6d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Divine Awareness
traits.desc: The solar knows if it hears a lie.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The solar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The solar makes two greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (4d6 + 8) slashing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Slaying Longbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +13 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage. If the target is a creature that has 100 hit points or fewer, it must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or die.

actions.name: Flying Sword
actions.desc: The solar releases its greatsword to hover magically in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. If the solar can see the sword, the solar can mentally command it as a bonus action to fly up to 50 feet and either make one attack against a target or return to the solar's hands. If the hovering sword is targeted by any effect, the solar is considered to be holding it. The hovering sword falls if the solar dies.

actions.name: Healing Touch (4/Day)
actions.desc: The solar touches another creature. The target magically regains 40 (8d8 + 4) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: The solar magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary_actions.name: Searing Burst (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The solar emits magical, divine energy. Each creature of its choice in a 10-foot radius must make a 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage plus 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Blinding Gaze (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The solar targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see it, the target must succeed on a 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until magic such as the lesser restoration spell removes the blindness.

spells: The solar's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 25). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect evil and good, invisibility (self only)

spells.3/day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, resurrection

monsters.name: Spectator
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
The Lost Dungeon of Rickedness: Big Rick Energy
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 2 (1d6 - 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Eye Rays
actions.desc: The spectator shoots up to two of the following magical eye rays at one or two creatures it can see within 90 feet of it. It can use each ray only once on a turn.

actions.name: 1. Confusion Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw, or it can't take reactions until the end of its next turn. On its turn, the target can't move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can't attack, it does nothing on its turn.

actions.name: 2. Paralyzing Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 3. Fear Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the spectator is visible to the target, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 4. Wounding Ray
actions.desc: The target must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Create Food and Water
actions.desc: The spectator magically creates enough food and water to sustain itself for 24 hours.

reactions.name: Spell Reflection
reactions.desc: If the spectator makes a successful saving throw against a spell, or a spell attack misses it, the spectator can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) it can see within 30 feet of it. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of the spectator. If the spell forced a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

monsters.name: Specter
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monsters.languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

monsters.name: Spider
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.desc: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.desc: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 9 Constitution saving throw or take 2 (1d4) poison damage.

monsters.name: Spined Devil
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The devil doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Limited Spines
traits.desc: The devil has twelve tail spines. Used spines regrow by the time the devil finishes a long rest.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The devil makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its fork or two with its tail spines.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (2d4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Fork
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail Spine
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 20/80 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

monsters.name: Spirit Naga
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.desc: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its hit points. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The naga is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following wizard spells prepared:

spells.Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, ray of frost

spells.1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, sleep

monsters.name: Sprite
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 1 slashing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +6 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. 1 piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. If its saving throw result is 5 or lower, the poisoned target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

actions.name: Heart Sight
actions.desc: The sprite touches a creature and magically knows the creature's current emotional state. If the target fails a 10 Charisma saving throw, the sprite also knows the creature's alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.desc: The sprite magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the sprite wears or carries is invisible with it.

monsters.name: Spy
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Eberron: Rising from the Last War
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep

traits.name: Cunning Action
traits.desc: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

traits.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
traits.desc: The spy deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spy makes two melee attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Steam Mephit

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.desc: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a cloud of steam. Each creature within 5 feet of the mephit must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw or take 4 (1d8) fire damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 2 (1d4) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

actions.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of scalding steam. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 10 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The mephit can innately cast blur, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

monsters.name: Stirge
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
The Lost Dungeon of Rickedness: Big Rick Energy

actions.name: Blood Drain
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the stirge's turns, the target loses 5 (1d4 + 3) hit points due to blood loss.
The stirge can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 10 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the stirge.

monsters.name: Stone Giant
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.desc: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +9 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Rock Catching
reactions.desc: If a rock or similar object is hurled at the giant, the giant can, with a successful 10 Dexterity saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

monsters.name: Stone Golem
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
monsters.damage_immunities: poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Slow (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Storm Giant
monsters.damage_resistances: cold

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The giant can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The giant makes two greatsword attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 30 (6d6 + 9) slashing damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +14 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. 35 (4d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Lightning Strike (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The giant hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: detect magic, feather fall, levitate, light

monsters.name: Succubus
source: Eberron: Rising from the Last War
Critical Role: Call of the Netherdeep
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.desc: The fiend ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has charmed. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The fiend can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Without wings, the fiend loses its flying speed. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Claw (Fiend Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Charm
actions.desc:
One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys the fiend's verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this fiend's Charm for the next 24 hours.
The fiend can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

actions.name: Draining Kiss
actions.desc: The fiend kisses a creature charmed by it or a willing creature. The target must make a 15 Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

actions.name: Etherealness
actions.desc: The fiend magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

monsters.name: Swarm of Bats
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.desc: The swarm can't use its blindsight while deafened.

traits.name: Keen Hearing
traits.desc: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny bat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. 5 (2d4) piercing damage, or 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monsters.name: Swarm of Beetles
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monsters.name: Swarm of Centipedes
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Bites
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.
A creature reduced to 0 hit points by a swarm of centipedes is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

monsters.name: Swarm of Insects
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Swarm
traits.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

actions.name: Bites
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

monsters.name: Swarm of Poisonous Snakes
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Swarm

traits.name: Swarm

actions.name: Bites

monsters.name: Tarrasque
source: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.damage_immunities: fire, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Reflective Carapace
traits.desc: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 36 (4d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape 20). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +19 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 28 (4d8 + 10) slashing damage.

actions.name: Horns
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 32 (4d10 + 10) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +19 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. 24 (4d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 20 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.desc: Each creature of the tarrasque's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.desc:
The tarrasque makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 (16d6) acid damage at the start of each of the tarrasque's turns.
If the tarrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting prone.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The tarrasque makes one claw attack or tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The tarrasque moves up to half its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The tarrasque makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

traits.name: Chameleon Carapace
traits.desc: The thri-kreen can change the color of its carapace to match the color and texture of its surroundings. As a result, it has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.desc: The thri-kreen's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The thri-kreen makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also paralyzed while poisoned in this way. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (2d4 + 1) slashing damage.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

traits.name: Keen Smell
traits.desc: The tiger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.desc: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
actions.desc: The treant magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the treant. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the treant dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the treant takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Bite

actions.name: Tail

traits.desc: The ultroloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The ultroloth's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Longsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Hypnotic Gaze
actions.desc: The ultroloth's eyes sparkle with opalescent light as it targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the ultroloth, the target must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be charmed until the end of the ultroloth's next turn. The charmed target is stunned. If the target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the ultroloth's gaze for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The ultroloth magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spells: The ultroloth's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17). The ultroloth can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spells.At will: alter self, clairvoyance, darkness, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, invisibility (self only), suggestion

spells.3/day each: dimension door, fear, wall of fire

monsters.name: Umber Hulk
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 10

traits.name: Confusing Gaze
traits.desc:
When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the umber hulk and is able to see the umber hulk's eyes, the umber hulk can magically force it to make a 15 Charisma saving throw, unless the umber hulk is incapacitated.
On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a d8 to determine what it does during that turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action but uses all its movement to move in a random direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes one melee attack against a random creature, or it does nothing if no creature is within reach.
Unless {@status surprised}, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the umber hulk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the umber hulk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.desc: The umber hulk can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5 foot-wide, 8-foot-high tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The umber hulk makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its mandibles.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

actions.name: Mandibles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

monsters.name: Unicorn

traits.name: Charge
traits.desc: If the unicorn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The unicorn's weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The unicorn makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Horn
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
actions.desc: The unicorn touches another creature with its horn. The target magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) hit points. In addition, the touch removes all diseases and neutralizes all poisons afflicting the target.

actions.name: Teleport (1/Day)
actions.desc: The unicorn magically teleports itself and up to three willing creatures it can see within 5 feet of it, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, to a location the unicorn is familiar with, up to 1 mile away.

legendary_actions.name: Hooves
legendary_actions.desc: The unicorn makes one attack with its hooves.

legendary_actions.name: Shimmering Shield (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The unicorn creates a shimmering, magical field around itself or another creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target gains a +2 bonus to AC until the end of the unicorn's next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Heal Self (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The unicorn magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) hit points.

spells: The unicorn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14). The unicorn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spells.At will: detect evil and good, druidcraft, pass without trace

spells.1/day each: calm emotions, dispel evil and good, entangle

monsters.name: Vampire
source: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc:
If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.
While in bat form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Misty Escape
traits.desc:
When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.
While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Vampire Weaknesses
traits.desc:
The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.
{@i Stake to the Heart.} If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

actions.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
actions.desc: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape 18).

actions.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire's control.

actions.name: Charm
actions.desc:
The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be charmed by the vampire. The charmed target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack.
Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

actions.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
actions.desc: The vampire magically calls 2d4 swarms of swarm of bats rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Unarmed Strike
legendary_actions.desc: The vampire makes one unarmed strike.

legendary_actions.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The vampire makes one bite attack.
