actions.desc: The thief makes three Shortsword or Shortbow attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Cunning Action
bonus_actions.desc: The thief takes the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

reactions.name: Uncanny Dodge
reactions.desc: The thief halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The thief must be able to see the attacker.

monsters.name: Maurezhi
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Assume Form
traits.desc: The maurezhi can assume the appearance of any Medium Humanoid it eats. It remains in this form for 1d6 days, during which time the form gradually decays until, when the effect ends, the form sloughs from the demon's body.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The maurezhi has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The maurezhi makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, its Charisma score is reduced by 1d4. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if this reduces its Charisma to 0. It rises 24 hours later as a ghoul  unless it has been revived or its corpse has been destroyed.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an Undead, it must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Raise Ghoul (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The maurezhi targets one dead ghoul or ghast it can see within 30 feet of it. The target is revived with all its hit points.

monsters.name: Maw Demon
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Disgorge (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The demon vomits in a 15-foot cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 11 Dexterity saving throw or take 11 (2d10) acid damage and fall prone in the spew.

actions.name: Garrote
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target of the meazel's size or smaller. 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 13 with disadvantage). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the meazel's turns. The meazel can't make weapon attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage

actions.name: Shadow Teleport (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
The meazel, any equipment it is wearing or carrying, and any creature it is grappling teleport to an unoccupied space within 500 feet of it, provided that the starting space and the destination are in dim light or darkness. The destination must be a place the meazel has seen before, but it need not be within line of sight. If the destination space is occupied, the teleportation leads to the nearest unoccupied space.
Any other creature the meazel teleports becomes cursed for 1 hour or until the curse is ended by remove curse or greater restoration. Until this curse ends, every Undead and every creature native to the Shadowfell within 300 feet of the cursed creature can sense it, which prevents that creature from hiding from them.

bonus_actions.name: Shadow Stealth
bonus_actions.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the meazel takes the {@action Hide} action.

traits.name: Fear Aura
traits.desc: Any Beast or Humanoid that starts its turn within 10 feet of the meenlock must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the creature's next turn.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.desc: While in bright light, the meenlock has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Shadow Teleport (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The meenlock teleports to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of it, provided that both the space it's teleporting from and its destination are in dim light or darkness. The destination need not be within line of sight.

monsters.name: Merregon
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.languages: understands Infernal but can't speak, telepathy 120 ft.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the merregon's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The merregon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The merregon makes three Halberd attacks.

actions.name: Halberd
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Heavy Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +4 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Loyal Bodyguard
reactions.desc: When another Fiend within 5 feet of the merregon is hit by an attack roll, the merregon causes itself to be hit instead.

monsters.name: Merrenoloth
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 14

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The merrenoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The merrenoloth makes one Oar attack and uses Fear Gaze.

actions.name: Oar
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) fire damage.

actions.name: Fear Gaze
actions.desc: The merrenoloth targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the merrenoloth for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Teleport
bonus_actions.desc: The merrenoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spells: The merrenoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.At will: charm person, darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, gust of wind

traits.name: Telepathic Hub
traits.desc: When the mindwitness receives a telepathic message, it can telepathically share that message with up to seven other creatures within 600 feet of it that it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The mindwitness makes one Bite attack and one Tentacles attack, or it uses Eye Ray three times.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 16 (4d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 20 (4d8 + 2) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape 13), and it must succeed on a 13 Intelligence saving throw or be restrained until this grapple ends.

actions.name: Eye Ray
actions.desc: The mindwitness shoots one magical eye ray at random (roll a d6, and reroll if the ray has already been used this turn), choosing one target it can see within 120 feet of it:

actions.name: 1: Aversion Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must make a 13 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 2: Fear Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 3: Psychic Ray
actions.desc: The target must succeed on a 13 Intelligence saving throw or take 27 (6d8) psychic damage.

actions.name: 4: Slowing Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must make a 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn but not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 5: Stunning Ray
actions.desc: The targeted creature must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 6: Telekinetic Ray
actions.desc:
If the target is a creature, it must make a 13 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the mindwitness moves it up to 30 feet in any direction, and it is restrained by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the mindwitness's next turn or until the mindwitness is incapacitated.
If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is telekinetically moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The mindwitness can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

monsters.name: Moloch
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Moloch fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Moloch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: Moloch regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Moloch dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Moloch makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Many-Tailed Whip attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 26 (4d8 + 8) fire damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 17 (2d8 + 8) force damage.

actions.name: Many-Tailed Whip
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +15 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. 13 (2d4 + 8) lightning damage plus 11 (2d10) thunder damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 24 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet in a straight line toward Moloch.

actions.name: Breath of Despair (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Moloch exhales in a 30-foot cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a 21 Wisdom saving throw or take 27 (5d10) psychic damage, drop whatever it is holding, and become frightened of Moloch for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, a creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from Moloch by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the {@action Dash} action. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to Moloch, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: Moloch teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Moloch makes one Bite, Claw, or Many-Tailed Whip attack.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: Moloch uses Teleport.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Moloch uses Spellcasting.

spells: Moloch casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 21):

spells.At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), confusion, detect magic, fly, major image, stinking cloud, suggestion, wall of fire

monsters.name: Molydeus
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, poisoned, stunned

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the molydeus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The molydeus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The molydeus makes one Demonic Weapon attack, one Snakebite attack, and one Wolf Bite attack.

actions.name: Demonic Weapon
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 35 (4d12 + 9) force damage. If the target has at least one head and the molydeus rolled a 20 on the attack roll, the target is decapitated and dies if it can't survive without that head. A target is immune to this effect if it takes none of the damage, has legendary actions, or is Huge or larger. Such a creature takes an extra 27 (6d8) force damage from the hit.

actions.name: Snakebite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. 16 (2d6 + 9) poison damage. The target must succeed on a 22 Constitution saving throw, or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target transforms into a manes if this reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This transformation can be ended only by a wish spell.

actions.name: Wolf Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 25 (3d10 + 9) necrotic damage.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The molydeus makes one Demonic Weapon or Snakebite attack.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The molydeus moves without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The molydeus uses Spellcasting.

spells: The molydeus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 22):

monsters.name: Morkoth
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 20

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The morkoth can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The morkoth makes either two Bite attacks and one Tentacles attack or three Bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and the morkoth can't use its tentacles on another target.

actions.name: Hypnosis
actions.desc: The morkoth projects a 30-foot cone of magical energy. Each creature in that area must make a 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by the morkoth for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the target tries to get as close to the morkoth as possible, using its actions to {@action Dash} until it is within 5 feet of the morkoth. A charmed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns and whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature has advantage on saving throws against the morkoth's Hypnosis for 24 hours.

reactions.name: Spell Reflection
reactions.desc: If the morkoth makes a successful saving throw against a spell or a spell attack misses it, the morkoth can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) it can see within 120 feet of it. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of the morkoth. If the spell forced a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

spells: The morkoth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 17):

spells.3/day each: darkness, dimension door, dispel magic, lightning bolt, sending

traits.name: Mouth of Chaos
traits.desc:
The giant is immune to the confusion spell.
On each of its turns, the giant uses all its movement to move toward the nearest creature or whatever else it might perceive as food. Roll a d10 at the start of each of the giant's turns to determine its action for that turn:

The giant makes three Fist attacks against one random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.
The giant makes one Fist attack against each creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, the giant makes one Fist attack against itself.
The giant makes one Bite attack against one random creature within reach. If no other creatures are within reach, its eyes glaze over and it is stunned until the start of its next turn.

The giant makes one Bite attack and two Fist attacks against one random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the giant magically regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Nabassu
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Demonic Shadows
traits.desc: The nabassu darkens the area around its body in a 10-foot radius. Nonmagical light can't illuminate this area of dim light.

traits.name: Devour Soul
traits.desc: A nabassu can eat the soul of a creature it has killed within the last hour, provided that creature is neither a Construct nor an Undead. The devouring requires the nabassu to be within 5 feet of the corpse for at least 10 minutes, after which it gains a number of Hit Dice (d8s) equal to half the creature's number of Hit Dice. Roll those dice, and increase the nabassu's hit points by the numbers rolled. For every 4 Hit Dice the nabassu gains in this way, its attacks deal an extra 3 (1d6) damage on a hit. The nabassu retains these benefits for 6 days. A creature devoured by a nabassu can be restored to life only by a wish spell.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The nabassu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nabassu makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, and it uses Soul-Stealing Gaze.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 38 (5d12 + 6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 28 (4d10 + 6) force damage.

actions.name: Soul-Stealing Gaze
actions.desc: The nabassu targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target isn't a Construct or an Undead, it must succeed on a 16 Charisma saving throw or take 13 (2d12) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage dealt, and the nabassu regains hit points equal to half that amount. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0, and if the target is a Humanoid, it immediately rises as a ghoul under the nabassu's control.

monsters.name: Nagpa
monsters.languages: Common plus up to five other languages

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nagpa makes three Staff or Deathly Ray attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 24 (7d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Deathly Ray
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 30 (7d6 + 6) necrotic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Corruption
bonus_actions.desc: The nagpa targets one creature it can see within 90 feet of it. The target must make a 20 Charisma saving throw. An evil creature makes the save with disadvantage. On a failed save, the target is charmed by the nagpa until the start of the nagpa's next turn. On a successful save, the target becomes immune to the nagpa's Corruption for the next 24 hours.

bonus_actions.name: Paralysis (Recharge 6-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The nagpa forces each creature within 30 feet of it to make a 20 Wisdom saving throw, excluding Undead and Constructs. On a failed save, a target is paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The nagpa casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 20):

spells.At will: detect magic, mage hand, message, minor illusion

spells.2/day each: fireball, fly, hold person, suggestion, wall of fire

monsters.name: Narzugon
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Infernal Tack
traits.desc: The narzugon wears spurs that are part of infernal tack companion as an action.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The narzugon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The narzugon makes three Hellfire Lance attacks. It also uses Infernal Command or Terrifying Command.

actions.name: Hellfire Lance
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) fire damage. If this damage kills a creature with a soul, the soul rises from the River Styx as a lemure in Avernus in 1d4 hours. If the creature isn't revived before then, only a wish spell or killing the lemure and casting true resurrection on the creature's original body can restore it to life. Constructs and devils are immune to this effect.

actions.name: Infernal Command
actions.desc: Each ally of the narzugon within 60 feet of it can't be charmed or frightened until the end of the narzugon's next turn.

actions.name: Terrifying Command
actions.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of the narzugon that isn't a Fiend must succeed on a 17 Charisma saving throw or become frightened of the narzugon for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that makes a successful saving throw is immune to this narzugon's Terrifying Command for 24 hours.

actions.name: Healing (1/Day)
actions.desc: The narzugon, or one creature it touches, regains 100 hit points.

monsters.name: Necromancer Wizard
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The necromancer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

actions.name: Arcane Burst
actions.desc: {@atk ms,rs} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. 25 (4d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Summon Undead (1/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The necromancer magically summons five skeleton. The summoned creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the necromancer, whom they obey. They take their turns immediately after the necromancer. Each lasts for 1 hour, until it or the necromancer dies, or until the necromancer dismisses it as a bonus action.

reactions.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
reactions.desc: When the necromancer kills a creature with necrotic damage, the necromancer regains 9 (2d8) hit points.

spells: The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 15):

spells.2/day each: bestow curse, dimension door, mage armor, web

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The neogi makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Enslave (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The neogi targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the neogi for 1 day, or until the neogi dies or is more than 1 mile from the target. The charmed target obeys the neogi's commands and can't take reactions, and the neogi and the target can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 1 mile. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 10 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monsters.name: Neogi Master
monsters.languages: Common, Deep Speech, Undercommon, telepathy 30 ft.

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the neogi's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Mental Fortitude
traits.desc: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The neogi makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, or it makes two Tentacle of Hadar attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tentacle of Hadar
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 14 (3d6 + 4) necrotic damage, and the target can't take reactions until the end of the neogi's next turn, as a spectral tentacle clings to the target.

bonus_actions.name: Enslave (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
bonus_actions.desc: The neogi targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed by the neogi for 1 day, or until the neogi dies or is more than 1 mile from the target. The charmed target obeys the neogi's commands and can't take reactions, and the neogi and the target can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 1 mile. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spells: The neogi casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 14):

spells.At will: guidance, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation

spells.1/day each: dimension door, hold person, hunger of Hadar

monsters.name: Neothelid
monsters.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 13

traits.name: Creature Sense
traits.desc: The neothelid is aware of the presence of creatures within 1 mile of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The neothelid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.desc:
Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 18 Strength saving throw or be swallowed by the neothelid. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the neothelid, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the neothelid's turns.
If the neothelid takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the neothelid must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the neothelid. If the neothelid dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The neothelid exhales acid in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spells: The neothelid casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

monsters.name: Nightwalker
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

traits.name: Annihilating Aura
traits.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the nightwalker must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. Undead are immune to this aura.

traits.name: Life Eater
traits.desc: A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by the nightwalker and can't be revived except by a wish spell.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The nightwalker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nightwalker makes two Enervating Focus attacks, one of which can be replaced by Finger of Doom, if available.

actions.name: Enervating Focus
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 28 (5d8 + 6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a 21 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Finger of Doom (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The nightwalker points at one creature it can see within 300 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 21 Wisdom saving throw or take 39 (6d12) necrotic damage and become frightened until the end of the nightwalker's next turn. While frightened in this way, the creature is also paralyzed. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the nightwalker's Finger of Doom for the next 24 hours.

monsters.name: Nilbog

traits.name: Nilbogism
traits.desc:
Any creature that attempts to damage the nilbog must first succeed on a 12 Charisma saving throw or be charmed until the end of the creature's next turn. A creature charmed in this way must use its action praising the nilbog.
The nilbog can't regain hit points, including through magical healing, except through its Reversal of Fortune reaction.

actions.name: Fool's Scepter
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Mocking Word
actions.desc: The nilbog targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or take 5 (2d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on its next attack roll before the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Nimble Escape
bonus_actions.desc: The nilbog takes the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action.

reactions.name: Reversal of Fortune
reactions.desc: In response to another creature dealing damage to the nilbog, the nilbog reduces the damage to 0 and regains 3 (1d6) hit points.

spells: The nilbog casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 12):

monsters.name: Nupperibo
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold
monsters.senses: blindsight 20 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 11

traits.name: Cloud of Vermin
traits.desc: Any creature, other than a devil, that starts its turn within 20 feet of one or more nupperibos must succeed on a 11 Constitution saving throw or take 5 (2d4) acid damage. A creature within the areas of two or more nupperibos makes the saving throw with disadvantage.

traits.name: Driven Tracker
traits.desc: In the Nine Hells, the nupperibo can flawlessly track any creature that has taken damage from any nupperibo's Cloud of Vermin within the previous 24 hours.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Oblex Spawn
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 12

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.desc: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Aversion to Fire
traits.desc: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The oblex doesn't require sleep.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) psychic damage.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The ogre deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ogre makes two Bash attacks.

actions.name: Bash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the ogre can push the target 5 feet away if the target is Huge or smaller.

reactions.name: Block the Path
reactions.desc: When a creature enters a space within 5 feet of the ogre, the ogre makes a Bash attack against that creature. If the attack hits, the target's speed is reduced to 0 until the start of the ogre's next turn.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Bolt Launcher
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +3 to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. 17 (3d10 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Fist
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Chain Smash (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a 14 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The target repeats the saving throw if it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Chain Sweep
actions.desc: The ogre swings its chain, and every creature within 10 feet of it must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

traits.name: Howdah
traits.desc: The ogre carries a compact fort on its back. Up to four Small creatures can ride in the fort without squeezing. To make a melee attack against a target within 5 feet of the ogre, they must use spears or weapons with reach. Creatures in the fort have three-quarters cover against attacks and effects from outside it. If the ogre dies, creatures in the fort are placed in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of the ogre.

actions.name: Mace
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Oinoloth
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.senses: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 17

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The oinoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The oinoloth makes two Claw attacks, and it uses Spellcasting or Teleport.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 14 (3d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 22 (4d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Corrupted Healing (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The oinoloth touches one willing creature within 5 feet of it. The target regains all its hit points. In addition, the oinoloth can end one disease on the target or remove one of the following conditions from it: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned. The target then gains 1 level of exhaustion, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 7 (2d6). This reduction can be removed only by a wish spell or by casting greater restoration on the target three times within the same hour. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.desc: The oinoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

bonus_actions.name: Bringer of Plagues (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.desc:
The oinoloth blights the area in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. The blight lasts for 24 hours. While the area is blighted, all normal plants there wither and die.
Furthermore, when a creature moves into the blighted area or starts its turn there, that creature must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and is poisoned. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the oinoloth's Bringer of Plagues for the next 24 hours.
The poisoned creature can't regain hit points. After every 24 hours that elapse, the poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's hit point maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10). This reduction lasts until the poison ends, and the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. The poison ends after the creature successfully saves against it three times.

spells: The oinoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

spells.At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, hold monster, invisibility (self only)

monsters.name: Orcus
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing that is nonmagical
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If Orcus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: Orcus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Master of Undeath
traits.desc: Orcus can cast animate dead (at will) and create undead (3/day). He chooses the level at which the spells are cast, and the creatures created by them remain under his control indefinitely. Additionally, he can cast create undead even when it isn't night.

traits.name: Special Equipment
traits.desc: Orcus wields the Wand of Orcus.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Orcus makes three Wand of Orcus, Tail, or Necrotic Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Wand of Orcus
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +19 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 24 (3d8 + 11) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (2d12) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 21 (3d8 + 8) force damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Necrotic Bolt
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. 29 (5d8 + 7) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Conjure Undead (1/Day)
actions.desc: While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus conjures {@filter Undead creatures|bestiary|type=undead} whose combined average hit points don't exceed 500. These creatures magically rise up from the ground or otherwise form in unoccupied spaces within 300 feet of Orcus and obey his commands until they are destroyed or until he dismisses them as an action.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Orcus makes one Tail or Necrotic Bolt attack.

legendary_actions.name: Creeping Death (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Orcus chooses a point on the ground that he can see within 100 feet of him. A cylinder of swirling necrotic energy 60 feet tall and with a 10-foot radius rises from that point and lasts until the end of Orcus's next turn. Creatures in that area have vulnerability to necrotic damage.

spells: Orcus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 23):

While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus casts one of the following spells (spell save 18), some of which require charges; the wand has 7 charges to fuel these spells, and it regains 1d4 + 3 charges daily at dawn:

spells.At will: animate dead (as an action), blight, speak with dead

spells.1 charges: circle of death, finger of death

monsters.name: Orthon
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft., truesight 30 ft., passive Perception 20

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The orthon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Infernal Dagger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d4 + 6) force damage, and the target must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the target is poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Brass Crossbow
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. 14 (2d10 + 3) force damage. The target also suffers one of the following effects of the orthon's choice; the orthon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

actions.name: Acid
actions.desc: The target must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an additional 17 (5d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Blindness
actions.desc: The target takes 5 (1d10) radiant damage. In addition, the target and all other creatures within 20 feet of it must each make a successful 17 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the orthon's next turn.

actions.name: Concussion
actions.desc: The target and each creature within 20 feet of it must make a 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 13 (2d12) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Entanglement
actions.desc: The target must make a successful 17 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained for 1 hour by strands of sticky webbing. The target can escape by taking an action to make a 17 Strength or Dexterity check and succeeding.

actions.name: Paralysis
actions.desc: The target takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage and must make a successful 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Tracking
actions.desc: For the next 24 hours, the orthon knows the direction and distance to the target, as long as it's on the same plane of existence. If the target is on a different plane, the orthon knows which one, but not the exact location there.

bonus_actions.name: Invisibility Field (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.desc: The orthon becomes invisible. Any equipment it wears or carries is also invisible as long as the equipment is on its person. This invisibility ends immediately after it makes an attack roll or is hit by an attack roll.

reactions.name: Explosive Retribution
reactions.desc: In response to dropping to 15 hit points or fewer, the orthon explodes. All other creatures within 30 feet of it must each make a 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) fire damage plus 9 (2d8) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The orthon, its infernal dagger, and its brass crossbow are destroyed.

traits.name: Beast of Burden
traits.desc: The ox is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the ox moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Phoenix
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned

traits.name: Fiery Death and Rebirth
traits.desc:
If the phoenix dies, it explodes. Each creature in 60-foot-radius sphere centered on the phoenix must make a 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
The explosion destroys the phoenix's body and leaves behind an egg-shaped cinder, which weighs 5 pounds. The cinder deals 21 (6d6) fire damage to any creature that touches it, though no more than once per round. The cinder is immune to all damage, and after 1d6 days, it hatches a new phoenix.

traits.name: Fire Form
traits.desc:
The phoenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
Any creature that touches the phoenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. In addition, the phoenix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.
With a touch, the phoenix can also ignite flammable objects that aren't worn or carried (no action required).

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The phoenix doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.desc: The phoenix sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the phoenix fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.desc: The phoenix deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The phoenix makes two attacks: one Beak attack and one Fiery Talons attack.

actions.name: Beak
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 15 (2d6 + 8) fire damage.

actions.name: Fiery Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 17 (2d8 + 8) fire damage.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The phoenix moves up to its speed.

legendary_actions.name: Peck
legendary_actions.desc: The phoenix makes one beak attack.

legendary_actions.name: Swoop (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The phoenix moves up to its speed and makes one Fiery Talons attack.

traits.name: Flyby
traits.desc: The quetzalcoatlus doesn't provoke an {@action opportunity attack} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the quetzalcoatlus flew least 30 feet toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

traits.name: Blurred Movement
traits.desc: Attack rolls against the quickling have disadvantage unless it is incapacitated or its speed is 0.

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the quickling is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The quickling makes three Dagger attacks.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 8 (1d4 + 6) piercing damage.

monsters.name: Red Abishai
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

traits.name: Devil's Sight
traits.desc: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's {@sense darkvision}.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The abishai makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, and it can use Frightful Presence or Incite Fanaticism.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 38 (7d10) fire damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 17 (2d10 + 6) force damage plus 11 (2d10) fire damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.desc: Each creature of the abishai's choice that is within 120 feet and aware of the abishai must succeed on a 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of it for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the abishai's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Incite Fanaticism
actions.desc: The abishai chooses up to four other creatures within 60 feet of it that can see it. Until the start of the abishai's next turn, each of those creatures makes attack rolls with advantage and can't be frightened.

actions.name: Power of the Dragon Queen
actions.desc: The abishai targets one Dragon it can see within 120 feet of it. The Dragon must make a 18 Charisma saving throw. A chromatic dragon makes this save with disadvantage. On a successful save, the target is immune to the abishai's Power of the Dragon Queen for 1 hour. On a failed save, the target is charmed by the abishai for 1 hour. While charmed in this way, the target regards the abishai as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. This effect ends if the abishai or its companions deal damage to the target.

traits.name: Iron Boots
traits.desc: The redcap has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

traits.name: Outsize Strength
traits.desc: While grappling, the redcap is considered to be Medium. Also, wielding a heavy weapon doesn't impose disadvantage on its attack rolls.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The redcap makes three Wicked Sickle attacks.

actions.name: Wicked Sickle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Ironbound Pursuit
actions.desc: The redcap moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and kicks with its iron boots. The target must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

monsters.name: Retriever
monsters.damage_immunities: necrotic, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monsters.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 15
monsters.languages: understands Abyssal, Elvish, and Undercommon but can't speak

traits.name: Faultless Tracker
traits.desc: The retriever is given a quarry by its master. The quarry can be a specific creature or object the master is personally acquainted with, or it can be a general type of creature or object the master has seen before. The retriever knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The retriever can have only one such quarry at a time. The retriever also always knows the location of its master.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The retriever makes two Foreleg attacks, and it uses Force Beam or Paralyzing Beam, if available.

actions.name: Foreleg
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Force Beam
actions.desc: The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (5d10) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Paralyzing Beam (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc:
The retriever targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
If the paralyzed creature is Medium or smaller, the retriever can pick it up as part of the retriever's move and walk or climb with it at full speed.

spells: The retriever casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save 13):

spells.3/day each: plane shift (only self and up to one incapacitated creature, which is considered willing for the spell), web

traits.name: Rancid Degeneration
traits.desc: At the end of each of the troll's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 11 (2d10) necrotic damage, unless the troll has taken acid or fire damage since the end of its last turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

monsters.name: Rutterkin
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

traits.name: Immobilizing Fear
traits.desc: When a creature that isn't a demon starts its turn within 30 feet of one or more rutterkins, that creature must make a 11 Wisdom saving throw. The creature has disadvantage on the save if it's within 30 feet of six or more rutterkins. On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened of the rutterkins for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature is restrained. At the end of each of the frightened creature's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Crippling Fear of all rutterkins for 24 hours.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Constitution saving throw against disease or become poisoned. At the end of each long rest, the poisoned target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points while poisoned in this way, it dies and instantly transforms into a living manes. The transformation can be undone only by a wish spell.

monsters.name: Sacred Statue
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: the languages the {@creature eidolon|MPMM} knew in life

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: If the statue is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the statue move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the statue isn't an object.

traits.name: Ghostly Inhabitant
traits.desc: The eidolon that enters the statue remains inside it until the statue drops to 0 hit points, the eidolon uses a bonus action to move out of the statue, or the eidolon is turned or forced out by an effect such as the dispel evil and good spell. When the eidolon leaves the statue, it appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the statue.

traits.name: Inert
traits.desc: Without an eidolon inside, the statue is an object.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The statue doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The statue makes two Slam or Rock attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 43 (6d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, range 60 ft./240 ft., one target. 37 (6d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monsters.name: Sea Spawn
monsters.languages: understands Aquan and Common but can't speak

traits.name: Limited Amphibiousness
traits.desc: The sea spawn can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged in the sea at least once a day for 1 minute to avoid suffocating.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sea spawn makes two Unarmed Strike attacks and one Piscine Anatomy attack.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Piscine Anatomy
actions.desc: The sea spawn uses one of the following options (choose one or roll a d6):

actions.name: 1–2: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: 3–4: Poison Quills
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 3 (1d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: 5–6: Tentacle
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 12) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the sea spawn can't use this tentacle on another target.

monsters.name: Shadar-kai Gloom Weaver

traits.name: Burden of Time
traits.desc: Beasts and Humanoids (except elves) have disadvantage on saving throws while within 10 feet of the shadar-kai.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The shadar-kai makes three Shadow Spear attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Shadow Spear
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120, one target. 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 26 (4d12) necrotic damage. Hit or Miss: The spear magically returns to the shadar-kai's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

reactions.name: Misty Escape (Recharge 6-6)
reactions.desc: When the shadar-kai takes damage, it turns invisible and teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains invisible until the start of its next turn or until it attacks or casts a spell.

spells: The shadar-kai casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

spells.At will: arcane eye, mage armor, minor illusion, prestidigitation, speak with dead

spells.1/day each: arcane gate, bane, confusion, darkness, fear, major image, true seeing

monsters.name: Shadar-kai Shadow Dancer
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc:
The shadar-kai makes three Spiked Chain attacks.
It can use Shadow Jump after one of these attacks.

actions.name: Spiked Chain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a 14 Dexterity saving throw or suffer one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):

actions.name: 1–2: Decay
actions.desc: The target takes 22 (4d10) necrotic damage.

actions.name: 3–4: Grapple
actions.desc: The target is grappled (escape 14) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the shadar-kai can't grapple another target.

actions.name: 5–6: Topple
actions.desc: The target is knocked prone.

bonus_actions.name: Shadow Jump
bonus_actions.desc: The shadar-kai teleports, along with any equipment is it wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it teleports from and the space it teleports to must be in dim light or darkness.

monsters.name: Shadar-kai Soul Monger

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.desc: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Soul Thirst
traits.desc: When it reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the shadar-kai can gain temporary hit points equal to half the creature's hit point maximum. While the shadar-kai has temporary hit points from this trait, it has advantage on attack rolls.

traits.name: Weight of Ages
traits.desc: Any Beast or Humanoid (except an elf) that starts its turn within 5 feet of the shadar-kai has its speed reduced by 20 feet until the start of that creature's next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The shadar-kai makes two Shadow Dagger attacks.

actions.name: Shadow Dagger
actions.desc: Melee / Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. 13 (4d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 19 (3d12) necrotic damage, and the target has disadvantage on saving throws until the end of the shadar-kai's next turn. Hit or Miss: The dagger magically returns to the shadar-kai's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

actions.name: Wave of Weariness (Recharge 4-6)
actions.desc: The shadar-kai emits weariness in a 60-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (10d8) psychic damage and suffers 1 level of exhaustion. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and doesn't gain a level of exhaustion.

spells: The shadar-kai casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save 16):

spells.1/day each: bestow curse, finger of death, gaseous form, seeming

monsters.name: Shadow Mastiff
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks while in dim light or darkness

traits.name: Ethereal Awareness
traits.desc: The shadow mastiff can see ethereal creatures and objects.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.desc: While in bright light created by sunlight, the shadow mastiff has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

bonus_actions.name: Shadow Blend
bonus_actions.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow mastiff becomes invisible, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. The invisibility lasts until the shadow mastiff uses a bonus action to end it or until the shadow mastiff attacks, is in bright light, or is incapacitated.

monsters.name: Shadow Mastiff Alpha
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks while in dim light or darkness

traits.name: Ethereal Awareness
traits.desc: The shadow mastiff can see ethereal creatures and objects.

traits.name: Sunlight Weakness
traits.desc: While in bright light created by sunlight, the shadow mastiff has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Terrifying Howl (Recharge 6)
actions.desc: The shadow mastiff howls. Any Beast or Humanoid within 300 feet of it must succeed on a 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of it for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to any shadow mastiff's Terrifying Howl for the next 24 hours.

bonus_actions.name: Shadow Blend
bonus_actions.desc: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow mastiff becomes invisible, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. The invisibility lasts until the shadow mastiff uses a bonus action to end it or until the shadow mastiff attacks, is in bright light, or is incapacitated.

monsters.name: Shoosuva
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The shoosuva makes one Bite attack and one Tail Stinger attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 26 (4d10 + 4) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Rampage
bonus_actions.desc: When it reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the shoosuva can move up to half its speed and make one Bite attack.

monsters.name: Sibriex
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, fire, lightning, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Contamination
traits.desc: The sibriex emits an aura of corruption 30 feet in every direction. Vegetation withers in the aura, and the ground in the aura is difficult terrain for other creatures. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a 20 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) poison damage. A creature that succeeds on the save is immune to this sibriex's Contamination for 24 hours.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the sibriex fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The sibriex has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The sibriex makes three Chain attacks, and it uses Squirt Bile.

actions.name: Chain
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. 20 (2d12 + 7) force damage.

actions.name: Squirt Bile
actions.desc: The sibriex targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 20 Dexterity saving throw or take 31 (9d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Warp Creature
actions.desc: The sibriex targets up to three creatures it can see within 120 feet of it. Each target must make a 20 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, a creature becomes immune to this sibriex's Warp Creature. On a failed save, the target is poisoned, which causes it to also gain 1 level of exhaustion. While poisoned in this way, the target must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. Three successful saves against the poison end it, and ending the poison removes any levels of exhaustion caused by it. Each failed save causes the target to gain another level of exhaustion. Once the target reaches 6 levels of exhaustion, it dies and instantly transforms into a living manes under the sibriex's control. The transformation of the body can be undone only by a wish spell.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell
legendary_actions.desc: The sibriex uses Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Spray Bile
legendary_actions.desc: The sibriex uses Squirt Bile.

legendary_actions.name: Warp (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The sibriex uses Warp Creature.

spells: The sibriex casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 21):

traits.name: Fallible Invisibility
traits.desc: The skulk is invisible. This invisibility can be circumvented by three things:

traits.name: Charnel Candles
traits.desc: The skulk appears as a dim, translucent form in the light of a candle made of fat rendered from a corpse whose identity is unknown.

traits.name: Children
traits.desc: Humanoid children, aged 10 and under, can see through this invisibility.

traits.name: Reflective Surfaces
traits.desc: The skulk appears as a drab, smoothskinned biped if its reflection can be seen in a mirror or on another surface.

traits.name: Trackless
traits.desc: The skulk leaves no tracks to indicate where it has been or where it's headed.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

monsters.name: Skull Lord
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned, stunned, unconscious
monsters.languages: all the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Evasion
traits.desc: If the skull lord is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half the damage, the skull lord instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't incapacitated.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the skull lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Master of the Grave
traits.desc: While within 30 feet of the skull lord, any Undead ally of the skull lord makes saving throws with advantage, and that ally regains 1d6 hit points whenever it starts its turn there.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The skull lord doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The skull lord makes three Bone Staff or Deathly Ray attacks.

actions.name: Bone Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Deathly Ray
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack +10 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. 27 (5d8 + 5) necrotic damage.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The skull lord makes one Bone Staff or Deathly Ray attack.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.desc: The skull lord moves up to its speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks}.

legendary_actions.name: Summon Undead (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The skull lord summons up to five skeleton in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of it. They remain until destroyed. Undead summoned in this way roll initiative, act in the next available turn, and obey the skull lord. The skull lord can have no more than five Undead summoned by this ability at a time.

spells: The skull, lord casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save 18):

spells.2/day each: dimension door, fear

monsters.name: Slithering Tracker
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: blinded, deafened, exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, unconscious
monsters.languages: understands languages it knew in its previous form but can't speak

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.desc: If the slithering tracker is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the slithering tracker move or act, that creature must succeed on a 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the slithering tracker isn't a puddle.

traits.name: Liquid Form
traits.desc: The slithering tracker can enter an enemy's space and stop there. It can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.desc: The slithering tracker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Life Leech
actions.desc:
One Large or smaller creature that the slithering tracker can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a 13 Dexterity saving throw or be grappled (escape 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. In addition, the grappled target takes 16 (3d10) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The slithering tracker can grapple only one target at a time.
While grappling the target, the slithering tracker takes only half any damage dealt to it (rounded down), and the target takes the other half.

bonus_actions.name: Watery Stealth
bonus_actions.desc: If underwater, the slithering tracker takes the {@action Hide} action, and it makes the Dexterity (Stealth) check with advantage.

monsters.name: Spawn of Kyuss
monsters.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The spawn of Kyuss regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or a body of running water. If the spawn takes acid, fire, or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the spawn's next turn. The spawn is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

traits.name: Worms
traits.desc: If the spawn of Kyuss is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away, and it loses its Burrowing Worm action.

traits.name: Unusual Nature
traits.desc: The spawn of Kyuss requires no air, food, drink, or sleep.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The spawn of Kyuss makes two Claw attacks, and it uses Burrowing Worm.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Burrowing Worm
actions.desc: A worm launches from the spawn of Kyuss at one Humanoid that the spawn can see within 10 feet of it. The worm latches onto the target's skin unless the target succeeds on a 11 Dexterity saving throw. The worm is a Tiny Undead with AC 6, 1 hit point, a 2 (-4) in every ability score, and a speed of 1 foot. While on the target's skin, the worm can be killed by normal means or scraped off using an action (the spawn can use Burrowing Worm to launch a scraped-off worm at a Humanoid it can see within 10 feet of the worm). Otherwise, the worm burrows under the target's skin at the end of the target's next turn, dealing 1 piercing damage to it. At the end of each of its turns thereafter, the target takes 7 (2d6) necrotic damage per worm infesting it (maximum of 10d6), and if it drops to 0 hit points, it dies and then rises 10 minutes later as a spawn of Kyuss. If a worm-infested target is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away.

monsters.name: Spirit Troll
monsters.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.damage_resistances: acid, cold, fire
monsters.condition_immunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, unconscious

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.desc: The troll can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.desc: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes psychic or force damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 19 (3d10 + 3) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a 15 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. 19 (3d10 + 3) psychic damage.

monsters.name: Spring Eladrin
monsters.damage_resistances: psychic

traits.name: Joyful Presence
traits.desc:
